title: Maxxima LED Dimmer Electrical Light Switch - 3-Way/Single Pole Use, 600 Watt Max, LED and Incandescent Compatible for Dimmable Home Lighting Needs, Wall Plate Cover Included - Almond

product_information.Best Sellers Rank: #66,191 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)   #133 in Dimmer Switches

shipping_info: FREE Wednesday, June 11 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
product_category: Tools & Home Improvement›Electrical›Switches & Dimmers›Wall Switches›Dimmer Switches
feature_bullets: Versatile Compatibility - This switch is 3-way and single pole compatible with a horizontal slide control for dimming. It comes in a sleek almond design, perfect for any modern home.

Capacity and Specifications - With a maximum capacity of 600W for incandescent and 150W for dimmable LED/CFL, this switch operates at 120VAC, 60Hz, making it a versatile device for your indoor lighting needs.

Adjustable Sensitivity - This switch works with LED, halogen, and incandescent bulbs. The trim dial below the cover plate allows sensitivity adjustment upon installation to achieve compatibility with LED lamps.
Wall Plate Included - Features a wall plate and mounting screws for easy installation. The plate serves as a cover for the switch, ensuring a neat and seamless look.
1 Year Warranty - This UL switch comes with a 1-year warranty for safe usage and installation. Upgrade your home's lighting control with this reliable device.
Not for use with ceiling fans, not for use with non-dimmable lighting.

customers_say: Customers find the dimmer switch works well with LED can lights and is easy to install, particularly on 2-way switches, with clear instructions and simple wire connections. They appreciate its smart appearance, adjustable dial, and consider it good value for money. The dimming ability and build quality receive mixed reviews - while some say it does a nice job and is sturdy, others report it barely dims and note cheap plastic construction. Additionally, flickering issues are reported, with some customers experiencing no issues while others mention flickering and humming problems.AI Generated from the text of customer reviews

customer_reviews.review_title: 5.0 out of 5 starsAll around great dimmer
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: An added feature is the sensitivity adjustment wheel that is hidden under the face plate after installation.  It allows for fine tuning for bright/dimming.

customer_reviews.rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars5.0 out of 5 stars
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2023
customer_reviews.review_snippet:
The media could not be loaded.
                
            
                
            
            
        
    
    








  
  
    My wife was pretty surprised how quickly I installed this (so was I).  The three-way wire is tagged, so you know which one to cap off if necessary (cap provided).  I was a little confused with the wiring of the house, and the fact that one wires was loose and came completely out before I could even remove the old switch didn't help matters.I would have appreciated longer screws to screw into the gang box, but it is what it is.  Anyway, I appreciate the adjustment wheel, which took a short while to figure out and get the settings just right, but I managed to find that sweet spot.  On the lowest (dimmest) setting, the lights will go out if I turn on the garbage disposal, but only for a brief moment; about the same length of time as a slow blink.  LEDs need a minimum amount of voltage to function and every device and appliance in your house draws more energy when it first kicks on than what it uses while operating.  Even as I write this review, the air conditioner kicked in and caused the lights to blink (keep in mind, they are at the lowest setting possible).This switch is certainly doing what I was hoping it would do and it wasn't overly difficult to install.  Price was pretty good, too.  I would recommend it.

customer_reviews.review_title: 5.0 out of 5 starsWorks great with dimmable LED lights - and don't forget to adjust the sensitivity dial!!
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2022
customer_reviews.review_snippet: This dimmer works great on a single pole switch for my dining room fixture that has 5 60W (equivalent) LED bulbs. I've seen reviews saying this dimmer doesn't work with LED bulbs. First, make sure you have dimmable LED bulbs as not all LED bulbs are dimmable. If they don't specifically say they are dimmable, they will not dim. Second, you must do the the thing the instructions tell you to do with the trim dial for sensitivity adjustment. This tells the dimmer what the lowest setting is and is absolutely necessary with LED lights. When my dimmer was first installed, the person who installed it didn't do the adjustment thing and the dimmer wouldn't work but then I read the instructions and watched some of the videos, and realized what was wrong. Without the adjustment, the dial is telling the dimmer that the lowest setting is full brightness. I did the adjustment and - viola! - working dimmer. Very happy with this dimmer!
